conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on hemispheres A and B.
Hemisphere A has weight, normal force from the left wall, frictional force from the left wall, normal force from hemisphere B, and frictional force from hemisphere B.
Hemisphere B has weight, normal force from hemisphere A, and frictional force from hemisphere A.
For hemisphere A, horizontal direction: \(N_A = N_{AB} \cos(30°)\).
For hemisphere A, vertical direction: \(W_A + f_A = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + N_A\).
For hemisphere B, horizontal direction: \(N_{BA} = N_{AB}\).
For hemisphere B, vertical direction: \(W_B = N_{BA} \sin(30°) + f_{BA}\).
Frictional forces are at their maximum, equal to sliding friction force.
From vertical direction for hemisphere A: \(m \cdot g + \mu N_A = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + N_A\).
From horizontal direction for hemisphere A: \(N_A = N_{AB} \cos(30°)\).
Substitute \(N_A\) into vertical equation for hemisphere A.
From vertical direction for hemisphere B: \(2m \cdot g = N_{AB} (\sin(30°) + \mu)\).
Substitute \(N_{AB}\) into equation for hemisphere A.
